name: International School Manila

other_fees.name: English as an Additional Language (EAL) Fee
other_fees.amount: $1,625 USD per semester (Year 1), $1,100 USD per semester (Year 2)

other_fees.name: Learning Support Services (LSS) Fee
other_fees.amount: $840 USD per semester (Level 1 Support), $1,890 USD per semester (Level 2 Support), $2,940 USD per semester (Level 3 Support)

other_fees.name: Speech Language Program
other_fees.amount: $575 USD per semester (Level 1 Support), $1,200 USD per semester (Level 2 Support)

other_fees.name: Car Stickers
other_fees.amount: PhP 100 per additional sticker (2nd to 4th), PhP 500 per additional sticker (5th and above)
other_fees.description: The first car sticker is provided for free.

other_fees.name: ID
other_fees.description: Initial student, 2-parent, 1-driver, 1-house help ID provided for free

programs.name: Elementary School Program
programs.grade_level: Preschool (covering two years), Kindergarten and Grades 1 to 4
programs.description: Integrated inquiry approach as curricular framework.

programs.name: Middle School Program
programs.description: Students take English, Social Studies, Mathematics, Science, Modern Language, Physical Education, Wellness and individual Elective options.

programs.name: High School Program
programs.description: Offers the International Baccalaureate (IB) Diploma and Advanced Placement (AP) classes.

programs.name: Specialized Learning Support Program
programs.description: Curriculum completely modified to meet the needs of students.

programs.name: English as an Additional Language (EAL)
programs.description: English language support is provided by a team of qualified EAL teachers and teaching assistants.

programs.name: Learning Support Program
programs.description: Students who need additional learning support are assisted by our Learning Support program, which incorporates both a Speech and Language Pathologist and Occupational Therapist (full time consultant to ISM).

requirements: Ability to demonstrate the ability to benefit from IS Manila’s academic program, as determined by interviews, tests and past records.
No unresolved disciplinary or emotional problems in their previous schools.
Reside with their parent(s) in the Philippines. Any exception must be approved by the School prior to commencing the admission process.
Age cut-off date is September 1st as per our Age Placement Policy. High School students should graduate no later than the age of 20.
Students who complete a particular grade level after the start of the IS Manila first semester will be placed in that same grade level for the remainder of the school year.

Students who are admitted after the middle of a given quarter may not receive grades for that semester. In the High School, 80% attendance is required for credit purposes. Attendance at a previous school can be applied towards the 80% attendance rule.
documents: Certificate of Employment or Letter of Guarantee (if applicable)
Official transfer document from current school (for transferring students)

process_steps.description: Submission of the Student Health Card and Physical Examination Record directly to the School Health Clinic to obtain a clearance signature on the Enrollment Clearance Form. Payment of Tuition and all other school-related fees. Submission of the signed Parent and School Shared Agreement form to the Admissions Office. Purchase school uniforms at the Uniform Shop. School photo IDs may be obtained at the Security Office. Applications for car sticker(s) are also available at the Security Office. Sign up for the bus service at the Transportation Office (optional). Sign up for the snack and/or lunch option at the Elementary School Canteen for Kindergarten - Grade 4 students (optional). Submission of a signed General Proxy for the Board of Trustees Form to the Admissions Office (optional).

scholarships.name: ISM Filipino Scholarship
scholarships.eligibility: Filipino citizenship, completed Grade 7, 13 years old by September 01, 2025, high academic achievement (no grade lower than 85% or its equivalent in any subject), demonstrate financial need, meet all regular ISM entrance requirements, excellent command of oral and written English, high personal standards and be in good health. Only one sibling per family shall be considered for the scholarship program. Dual citizens are not eligible for the scholarship program.
scholarships.amount: Tuition fee, matriculation fee, and book rental. A participation fee may be required from the parents to cover a portion of the school fees.
scholarships.description: For students entering Grade 8. Applications for SY 2025-2026 now closed. The scholarships may be enjoyed for five years provided the awardees maintain the appropriate scholastic level and abide by the school rules and regulations set by the Philippine Scholarship Committee.

contact.address: University Parkway, Fort Bonifacio Global City, Taguig City 1634, Philippines

notes: Applications for SY 2025-2026 scholarships are closed. Campus Office Hours: Monday-Friday, 7:00AM-4:00PM (Cashier closes at 3:15PM). Campus Operating Hours: Monday-Friday, 7:00AM-5:00PM. Saturday, as per events calendar. Sunday, Campus CLOSED.
